item.title: Graph ends and their purpose in geometric group theory
item.description: I’ll give an intuition for how mathematicians define what graph ends are, and explain their use in geometric group theory. However, before I can do that, I’ll explain what ends are in a graph theory perspective. What are ends? The word ends is a little confusing, because they don’t really represent the “end” of a graph, at least not how we would define an end in real life. Think of a rope.
